update.description:
This pull request changes the queue message such that it alerts the user if segway is running locally (whether this is intentional or because DRMAA was installed incorrectly).

This is in relation to [issue 52](#!/hoffmanlab/segway/issues/52/segway-silently-ignores-drmaa-if-installed).

I've tested this for all of: locally, DRMAA_LIBRARY_PATH set incorrectly for a cluster system, and set correctly for a cluster system, and all give the expected outputs.
update.title: Change the queue message such that it alerts the user if segway is running locally (whether this is intentional or because DRMAA was installed incorrectly).

content.raw: Place this in an "else" clause. `job_location`, even inside conditionals, will still be in scope for the following print statement.

content.raw:
Both strings share the same same end string `%s: %s (%s)" % (res, jobname, res_req)` and both `print >>sys.stderr`. "running locally" and "queued" should be the only strings to consider in the conditional. Something like 


```
#!python

job_location = "queued"
if DRIVER_NAME_OVERRIDE == "local":
     job_location = "running locally"
```
content.html:
Both strings share the same same end string %s: %s (%s)" % (res, jobname, res_req) and both print >>sys.stderr. "running locally" and "queued" should be the only strings to consider in the conditional. Something like 

job_location = "queued"
if DRIVER_NAME_OVERRIDE == "local":
     job_location = "running locally"
